channel.title: Smf admin control panel a little messed :S
channel.description:
I'm using SMF 2.0.4, when I try edit user groups for example and try change the image or amount of stars, when I press save the changes do not take place and it would redirect me to the forum index. There is nothing wrong with what I am trying to do, a lot of the other options do not work either.
Anybody know what could be causing this? According to the maintenance check, there is nothing wrong.

item.title: Smf admin control panel a little messed :S
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Arcik:

I wouldn’t know what the related file is.

Right. Sources/ManageMembergroups.php. Follow the above instructions.

Read full topic

item.source: Smf admin control panel a little messed :S

item.title: Smf admin control panel a little messed :S
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:5, topic:525198”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=643889.msg4334123#msg4334123 date=1374079913]

I’m using SMF 2.0.4, when I try edit user groups for example and try change the image or amount of stars, when I press save the changes do not take place and it would redirect me to the forum index. There is nothing wrong with what I am trying to do, a lot of the other options do not work either.

Anybody know what could be causing this? According to the maintenance check, there is nothing wrong.

That’s some pretty strange behaviour. Anything in the error log? Any recent mods? Any manual changes to that file lately?
[/quote]

Nothing Just thought grew a mind of its own![/quote]

Well then this suggests maybe the file was somehow edited? I don’t really know but maybe the file should be replaced with a newer one. Make sure you make the current file a backup in case anything breaks (but I doubt anything serious). If you have a .php~ for the file that is having the problems, rename and use that file because SMF made that a backup. If you don’t have that file on your server, then get a new copy of SMF and upload a new one. See if that resolves the issue.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Lin:

Take a look at your database using phpMyAdmin. Maybe your tables are messed up or not being edited properly.

They look fine, I’m currently using phpmyadmin to edit everything I can’t in the control panel lol
